page.title: 19ULLEY HALL FARM
page.content: { { Ulley Hall Farm is an arable farm of four hundred and seventy one acres.It is situated at the east end of Ulley and the large farmhouse was built by Sam Burke in 1718.The present farmer is Mr.Longford,who like the other farmers in Ulley is a tenant farmer.Most of the land is still owned by Lord Halifax. Being an arable farm a great deal of equipment is required to keep the farm working.The combine harvesters are owned by the farmer and cost around thirty five thousand pounds each.They also own huge grain drying plants,tractors and rollers.The grain drying plants are a great help to the farmer should the weather at harvest time be bad.Helicopters are used to spray fertiliser on the crops.
